messages.content: ComfyUI-PhotoMaker-ZHO is an unofficial implementation of PhotoMaker for ComfyUI.
Which version of ComfyUI-PhotoMaker-ZHO supports Lora, multiple batches, and a universal styler?
Version 2.5 of ComfyUI-PhotoMaker-ZHO supports Lora, multiple batches, and a universal styler.
What is the purpose of the Ref Image Preprocessing node in ComfyUI-PhotoMaker-ZHO?

The Ref Image Preprocessing node in ComfyUI-PhotoMaker-ZHO is used for preprocessing single or multiple reference images. It supports direct input of images and automatic reading of all images in a specified path.
How many styles are officially supported by ComfyUI-PhotoMaker-ZHO?

ComfyUI-PhotoMaker-ZHO officially supports 10 different styles, including Cinematic, Disney Character, Digital Art, Photographic (Default), Fantasy art, Neonpunk, Enhance, Comic book, Lowpoly, and Line art.
What are the two modes supported by the Ref Image Preprocessing node in ComfyUI-PhotoMaker-ZHO?

The Ref Image Preprocessing node in ComfyUI-PhotoMaker-ZHO supports two modes: Direct_input for connecting single or multiple images, and Path_input for automatically reading all images in a specified path.
How can ComfyUI-PhotoMaker-ZHO be installed manually?

To install ComfyUI-PhotoMaker-ZHO manually, follow these steps: 1. cd custom_nodes, 2. git clone https://github.com/ZHO-ZHO-ZHO/ComfyUI-PhotoMaker.git, 3. cd custom_nodes/ComfyUI-PhotoMaker, 4. pip install -r requirements.txt, 5. Restart ComfyUI.
What is the default number of steps in the PhotoMaker Generation node of ComfyUI-PhotoMaker-ZHO?
The default number of steps in the PhotoMaker Generation node of ComfyUI-PhotoMaker-ZHO is 50, but tests have shown that 30 steps are sufficient since it is based on the SDXL model.
